author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

`[noblock]`

I feel conspicuous registering a package with such a common name. See my [Discourse Post](https://discourse.julialang.org/t/ann-licenses-jl-help-with-naming/98822/8) on the topic. Please let me know if you have alternative names, or guidance.

> How about `SoftwareLicenses.jl` or `ContentLicenses.jl`?

Yeah we talked about `SoftwareLicenses` in the Discourse post, that title feels a bit misleading to me because this package also pulls licenses for other forms of content, like writing and visual media with Creative Commons licenses. 

For `ContentLicenses`, I feel the word `Content` doesn't add much. But what about `CommonLicenses` â€” all of the licenses provided by this package are "standard" or "common", so a word like that adds something to the meaning of the package name imo. 

I am totally okay with merging `Licenses.jl`, but I wanted to give maintainers and the general community the opportunity to veto `Licenses.jl`. I'm going to change the package name to `CommonLicenses.jl`. If there are no objections, could you please add `[noblock]` to your comment @DilumAluthge?
Huh, didn't realize a new pull request would be created after the package rename since it has the same UUID! **This PR should be closed**; see https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/83584.

This pull request has been inactive for 30 days and will be automatically closed 7 days from now. If this pull request should not be closed, please either (1) fix the AutoMerge issues and re-trigger Registrator, which will automatically update the pull request, or (2) post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. [noblock]
This pull request has been inactive for more than 30 days and has automatically been closed. Feel free to register your package or version again once you fix the AutoMerge issues. [noblock]
